content.text: Bash tar Command - An archiving utility
The tar command is used to create, maintain, modify, and extract files from an archive file.
content.html: The tar command is used to create, maintain, modify, and extract files from an archive file.

content.text: Here are some common options you can use with the tar command:
content.html: Here are some common options you can use with the tar command:

content.text: The -c option creates a new archive with the specified files.
content.html: The -c option creates a new archive with the specified files.

content.code:
tar
-cvf archive.tar file1 file2
file1
file2
content.code_html:
tar -cvf archive.tar file1 file2
file1
file2

content.text: The -x option extracts files from an archive.
content.html: The -x option extracts files from an archive.

content.code_html:
tar -xvf archive.tar
file1
file2

content.text: The -t option lists the contents of an archive without extracting them.
content.html: The -t option lists the contents of an archive without extracting them.

content.code:
tar
-tvf archive.tar
-rw-r--r-- user/user 1234 2025-04-10 12:00 file1
-rw-r--r-- user/user 5678 2025-04-10 12:00 file2
content.code_html:
tar -tvf archive.tar
-rw-r--r-- user/user 1234 2025-04-10 12:00 file1
-rw-r--r-- user/user 5678 2025-04-10 12:00 file2

content.text: The -z option filters the archive through gzip, compressing or decompressing it.
content.html: The -z option filters the archive through gzip, compressing or decompressing it.

content.code:
tar
-czvf archive.tar.gz file1 file2
file1
file2
content.code_html:
tar -czvf archive.tar.gz file1 file2
file1
file2

content.text: The -f option specifies the filename of the archive to create or operate on. It should be used as the last option before the archive name.
content.html: The -f option specifies the filename of the archive to create or operate on. It should be used as the last option before the archive name.

content.code:
tar
-cvf archive.tar file1 file2
file1
file2
content.code_html:
tar -cvf archive.tar file1 file2
file1
file2

content.text: The -v option provides verbose output, listing files as they are processed.
content.html: The -v option provides verbose output, listing files as they are processed.

content.code_html:
tar -xvf archive.tar
file1
file2
